comments.commentBody:
Anatole France: "The law, in its majestic equality, forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread."

And in its pernicious inequality, permits the rich to elude the courts altogether, while filling the prisons with the poor through mandatory minimum sentencing.

Who writes the laws and controls the political economy? Who owns all the financial and corporate assets? Who determines what is just? Who owns the poor?

Could Hillary even get security clearance?
I think POTUS would need one, no?

So, what are you doing about getting George Bush an appointment with the Hague? We are still waiting for the GOP to get its rear in gear about setting the record straight and apologizing to the USA.

Or is the playing detective just for emails and not starting phoney wars.

Note the two things in common and one thing different between Clinton and Petraeus:

Clinton didn't have criminal intent. So didn't Petraeus. This is the first thing in common.

As such, Petraeus couldn't be charged with intentionally criminal activities. He could only be charged with gross negligence. Here comes the second thing in common: Clinton committed, without doubt, gross negligence as well, only much worse.

The difference: Petraeus had been prosecuted, Clinton was not.

The unfairness is to seeming that one could hardly believe this is actually happening, and happening in the America.

Plus the time line:
The meeting between the AG and Bill Clinton, which enables the AG conveniently to "accept" the FBI's recommendation not to prosecute Hillary Clinton; The FBI's interview with Hillary Clinton shortly after the meeting and Comey's announcement of his recommendation shortly after the interview, hours before Obama campaigning with Hillary Clinton.

Have we been watching a real-time play of House of Cards?

Of course, as usual, there is no smoking gun.

It should be apparent now that there is a dark force who is so good at playing the rule of law and democracy to their favour. It's up to people to defend them. People are the last defence of them. If we don't act, then there will be no future for the rule of law, democracy and the America.
And...others (Bush/Cheney) have gotten away with more serious "crime" like lying about the weapons of mass destruction and starting unnecessary wars. Shouldn't they have been impeached?
Bernie Sanders' supporters would be defending her if it weren't for him.

Republicans are crying "Fix!". They are sure that if Trump were president, something would have been found strong enough to prefer charges and indict Clinton. And that is precisely why Trump should not be president. We are a nation of laws. If the FBI director finds no chargeable offenses, we are not a nation where political ideology or partisan pressure results in indictments without sufficent evidence to convict. We are a nation of laws, where the courts are not used to intimidate or bully our politican foes into submission or defeat. We are a nation of laws, where our courts should not be used as agents of business to avoid payment of due debts. That is precisely why Trump should not be president.

I am not excited about Clinton's nomination.

As person of at least some level of reason one must not allow Trump the WH.

There is no choice here. Period.

It's absolutely fascinating how people can take the same information and see two vastly different scenarios. I don't believe this will impact the election at all. The Hillary-haters will still hate and the Hillary-supporters will still support.
I'd be pretty concerned if the Republicans dumped Trump and nominated Comey with Kasich or someone similar with legislative experience as VP.
Petraeus handed over top secret communications, lots of them, to his mistress who was also writing his biography. And then he lied about it. You are channeling Trump's off the wall tweets!

I don't think it matters what her intent was. What matters is the extent of her ability to do irreparable harm to our country and the rest of the world, and the likelihood that she will do so. It matters not one bit in most of our lives whether a person starts wars out of malice or stupidity. The fallout for the rest of us is the same.
Note that what you wished for did not happen because, hours later, Trump was drowning out the Email news by blowing kisses to the late Saddam Hussein.

I just don't care about what email server Hillary Clinton used; there are so many hugely important issues facing our country and world. The media jumped on this because a "scandal" makes news. How about some real scandals: Special Education in the U.S has never been fully funded because Republicans don't support it. Hillary supports full funding. Assault rifles are legal; now there's a scandal. Hillary would restrict assault rifles and implement background checks. Individual states have implemented restrictive voting requirements to discourage poor people and non-white people from voting. Now, that's a scandal.
Some animals are more equal than others.

People simply don't understand that this was  being careless with classified information. With the security clearance she had, the implications could be extremely damaging to this country and our allies. Had any other government employee done this, they'd be facing multiple felony charges and probably sitting in jail.

They never used private email servers. They had a State Dept email address for business communication, and private email addresses for personal use.
They never had a private server. Do you understand the difference?
Hillary never had a state dept email address. Do you get that?
She never had a business email.
Only her personal email.
That she stored on her private server.
There is no comparison between what Hillary did and what Powell & Rice did.
How can people be so ignorant?

As Hillary has often said, past performance is the best indicator of future behavior. Revoke her security clearance for her "extremely careless" behavior! The only Situation Room she'd be allowed in would have Wolf Blitzer sitting across the desk!
You called it. Ryan on Megan Kelly show: http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/ryan-gop-will-hold-hearings-on-cl...

With no indictment, this all makes no difference whatsoever in the campaign. Everyone already has their mind made up about Clinton. This changes nothing, and all these comments provide a pretty good illustration of that fact.

Judgment?? Obama is just another politician. Never mind that he's campaigning for her. He put her into the SOS position without a stitch of experience. Talk about putting politics over the country's best interests.

And now he's doing it again.

It's interesting that Trump and his supporters are so indignant about the findings being that the writing has been on the wall for a long time for those who could see it. It does seem to me though, that they should be more worried about what the investigations on Trump for his illegal campaign solicitations and defrauding the people who bought into his university scam are going to reveal.
AAC: If you lose, like 20 times in a row, with NO results, maybe it isnt "her". Maybe it is you.
Wrong.  No other politician has ever "used similar practices."  Hillary's case is beyond anything they ever did.
or (D) The GOP is finally just some collection of Mr. Magoos who keep hitting themselves over the head with a hammer, waiting for a different result.

Don’t know what country you’re living in, but it was Obama’s “Justice” Department.  It was hardly “desperate”, but had it been “republicans”, she’d be doing time in Leavenworth before it was over–not a bad place for her given her recklessness.  Bill, on the other, was just having a good time.

Dr E:  In point of fact, it was the FBI, not "republicans" investigating this issue and the FBI wasn't "in a desperate attempt to find anything politically damaging..." They were, presumably, investigating matters for questions of national security and any possible crimes. Does that matter to you?  Have you heard or read any of Hillary Clinton's words about what she thinks should happen to Edward Snowden?  Apparently she doesn't like leaks and breaches when they expose HER or her cronies, but when her "carelessness" exposes classified information - that's a "mistake."  She should call Snowden and forgive him his "mistake" and let him come back to the U.S. - hey! it's another potential voter.

TR2 and Annie - last I checked, the email non-scandal was a tangential offshoot of the Republican "investigations" into Benghazi...another politically motivated non-scandal. Neither investigation has found anything of substance and so the best they can do to try and get some political bang for their buck is to convince Comey, a republican, say some nasty things about her as he explains why they are dropping the investigation.

This non-issue perfectly encapsulates how dumbed down our politics and political reporting has become. No one apparently cares about the issues facing our country; or that the next Hitler or Hussein could be elected as our president (yes Trump just recently sent out antisemitic tweets from a white supremacist and tonight praised Saddam). And no one seems to care about the context (Colin Powell and Confoleeza Rice also had classified emails on their private servers) or proportionality (no one hurt, no laws broken)

Millions of dollars and thousands of man hours spent by republicans investigating Clinton in a desperate attempt to find anything politically damaging, and all they can come up with is a careless selection of email servers ? Are you kidding me?

And the media just regurgitates it straight from the republican PR machine's mouth with little context caveat or proportionality applied.
He did not use a private server.  He used a personal email account.
